question: Question 2-12/19/2012 The total amount of reactivity added by inserting or withdrawing a control rod from a reference height to any other rod height is called?

answers.answer: a. differential rod worth
b. shutdown reactivity
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: Vol. II, Module 3, see heading “Integral and Differential Rod Worths” discussion on pages 51 through 56.

answers.answer: c. integral rod worth
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: Vol. II, Module 3, see heading “Integral and Differential Rod Worths” discussion on pages 51 through 56.

answers.answer: d. reference reactivity
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: Vol. II, Module 3, see heading “Integral and Differential Rod Worths” discussion on pages 51 through 56.

question: Question 4-12/19/2012 Reactor power is rising on a 100 second period. Approximately how long will it take for power to double?

answers.answer: a. 35 seconds
answers.feedback: Incorrect. P = P0 et/T ––> ln(2) = time ÷ 100 seconds –> time = ln (2) x 100 sec. 0.693 x 100 ≈ 0.7 x 100 ≈ 70 sec.

answers.answer: b. 50 seconds
answers.feedback: Incorrect. P = P0 et/T ––> ln(2) = time ÷ 100 seconds –> time = ln (2) x 100 sec. 0.693 x 100 ≈ 0.7 x 100 ≈ 70 sec.

answers.answer: c. 70 seconds
d. 100 seconds
answers.feedback: Incorrect. P = P0 et/T ––> ln(2) = time ÷ 100 seconds –> time = ln (2) x 100 sec. 0.693 x 100 ≈ 0.7 x 100 ≈ 70 sec.

question: Question 5-12/19/2012 Reactor period has just stabilized at -80 seconds following a reactor shutdown. If safety channel #1 reads 1 × 104 counts/minute, what do you expect the channel to read in three minutes?

answers.answer: a. 3 × 10^3 counts/minute
b. 1 × 10^3 counts/minute
c. 3 × 10^2 counts/minute
d. 1× 10^2 counts/minute

question: Question 6-12/19/2012 Most references list the delayed neutron fraction for U235 (β) as 0.0065. The SAR lists β for the core as 0.0074. The β in the SAR is more commonly referred to as βeffective. Which ONE of the following is the reason that βeffective is larger than β?

answers.answer: a. Delayed neutrons are born at higher energies than prompt neutrons resulting in a greater worth for the neutrons.
b. Delayed neutrons are born at lower energies than prompt neutrons resulting in less leakage during slowdown to thermal energies.
c. The fuel also includes U238 which has a relatively large β for fast fission.
d. The U238 in the core becomes Pu239 (by neutron absorption), which has a higher β for fission.

question: Question 7-12/19/2012 Which of the following power manipulations would take the longest to complete assuming the same period is maintained?

answers.answer: a. 100 mW to 400 mW
b. 400 mW to 500 mW
c. 1 W to 3.5 W
d. 3.5 W to 4.5 W

question: Question 8-12/19/2012 Which ONE of the following is the definition of a cross section?

answers.answer: a. The probability that a neutron will be captured by the nucleus.
b. The most likely energy at which a charged particle will be captured.
c. The length a charged particle travels past the nucleus before being captured.
d. The area of the nucleus including the electron cloud.

question: Question 9-12/19/2012 Which of the following algebraic terms is the effective multiplication factor (Keff)?

answers.answer: a. # of neutrons produced from all fission/# of neutrons in the previous generation
b. # of neutrons produced from fast fission/# of neutrons produced from thermal fission
c. # of neutrons absorbed in the fuel/# of neutrons absorbed by fission products
d. # of neutrons in the present generation/# of neutrons in the previous generation
a. A measure of the core's deviation from criticality.
b. A measure of the core's fuel depletion.
c. Negative when Keff is greater than 1.0.
d. Equal to $0.66 when the reactor is prompt critical.
